entry.title: King Of Spice - Allspice Whole - 2.27 Kg
entry.summary:
Vendor: King of Spice
Type: FOOD
Price: 27.99

King Of Spice - Allspice Whole - 5 Lbs

Bulk Whole Spices Add Flavor to Your Favorite Food and Drink Recipes

Whole spices are loaded with flavor. They can be used whole for an aesthetically pleasing presentation or ground up just before use for added freshness.

Try adding this spice to salsa, guacamole, and taco or enchilada sauces for extra flavor, or allow guests to season their own meals via front-of-house condiment stations. Whether you run a Mexican or Indian restaurant, pizzeria, or upscale bistro, this spice is sure to take your food to the next level.

Its a pantry staple that can be used in marinades, tomato-based sauces, and soups. Whether you own a pizzeria, Italian restaurant, or upscale bistro, this spice is the perfect addition to all of your favorite menu items.

The unique and delicious flavor and aroma is commonly used in Asian, Middle Eastern, Latin American, and Italian cuisines. However, it also works well with traditional Canadian and American dishes.

The bulk pack of spices is a cost-efficient option for high-volume kitchens and can easily be portioned into smaller quantities. Dehydrated spices also last longer than fresh ingredients and are easier to store, making them the perfect addition to any busy, high-output kitchen.

While basil has a great prominence in Italian cooking, it originates from India and the Near East. In the west, Basil was well loved. Ancient Greeks called it the “royal herb.” Basil is regularly used in Italian, Indian, Thai and Mediterranean dishes. This herb pairs well with tomato. Learn how basil tastes, how to use basil and basil recipes below.

entry.title: Club House - Thyme Leaves - 175 g
entry.summary:
Vendor: Club House
Type: FOOD
Price: 9.99

Club House - Dried Thyme Leaves Jar - 175 g

Thyme or fully known as Thymus vulagaris is a low growing herbaceous plant, sometimes becoming somewhat woody. Thyme has a mighty flavour and armoa courtesy of the tindy dark green leaves. The leaves are known for their spicy and resinous aroma which add a distinctive aromatic flavoring to sauces, stews, stuffings, meats, poultry – almost anything from soup to salad.
Thyme is used in flavouring chowder, meats, sausage, cottage cheese, creamed chipped beef, creamed chicken, Creole seafood dishes, poultry dressing, tomatoes, marinades, vegetables, fish, and cheese dishes. Thyme butter is good over creamed white onions, asparagus, green beans and eggplant. Whole spices are best suited to long cooking recipes and should be added as soon as cooking begins to yield greatest amount of flavour.

The dried leaves of the Anethum Graveolens (family Umbelliferae) they are bright green and impart a pleasing flavour to mild or bland foods. Dill Weed is subtle and fresh in flavour; it is characterized by sweet, green/grassy, tea like and rye notes.
Use to season cheese, shrimp, cream soup, gazpacho, lamb, butter for fish, chicken, green beans and carrots. It is superb in creamed peas or fish sauces, sour cream and oil and vinegar dressing.

entry.title: Club House - Rosemary Leaves - 275 g
entry.summary:
Vendor: Club House
Type: FOOD
Price: 11.99

Club House - Dried Rosemary Leaves - 275 g

Rosemary Leaves are slender, slightly curved and grayish green in colour and resemble miniature curved pine needles. Harvested from the evergreen Rosmarinus officinalis, it is a highly prized culinary herb. Rosemary has a fresh, sweet, piney flavour.
Rosemary Leaves complement lamb, pork, veal, sausage, poultry, oily fish, game, tomato sauce, vegetables, soups, breads and marinades. To release the flavour of Rosemary Leaves, gently crush them before adding to your recipe. Rosemary Leaves are well suited to lamb and pork dishes. Gently roast a loin of pork with olive oil, Minced Garlic and Rosemary Leaves. Add Rosemary Leaves to the liquid used for poaching salmon or halibut.

Try adding this spice to salsa, sauces, taco or your authentic cuisines for extra flavor, or allow guests to season their own meals via front-of-house condiment stations. Whether you run a Mexican or Indian restaurant, pizzeria, or upscale bistro, this spice is sure to take your food to the next level.

Its a pantry staple that can be used in marinades, tomato-based sauces, and soups. Whether you own a pizzeria, Italian restaurant, or upscale bistro, this spice is the perfect addition to all of your favorite menu items.

The unique and delicious flavor and aroma is commonly used in Asian, Middle Eastern, Latin American, and Italian cuisines. However, it also works well with traditional Canadian and American dishes.

The bulk pack of spices is a cost-efficient option for high-volume kitchens and can easily be portioned into smaller quantities. Dehydrated spices also last longer than fresh ingredients and are easier to store, making them the perfect addition to any busy, high-output kitchen.
